title: French elections: The left is under pressure to agree on a candidate for prime minister
summary: Both the right and Macron deny that the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire bloc has won the snap elections, increasing the pressure on the alliance.

title: French elections: Macron's letter to the French rekindles political crisis
summary: In a text published in the regional press on Wednesday, the French president wrote that 'no one' won the snap elections and urged parties to build a 'broad' coalition.

title: 'Hardly anything' will stop Israel's war on Gaza, says South African ICJ judge
summary: In an interview with AFP, Nambitha Dambuza regrets the limited constraints on Israel in its military offensive. But she says South Africa's case remains vital.

title: On NATO's doorstep, a symbolic military exercise between China and Belarus
summary: The armed forces of Beijing and Minsk are conducting joint maneuvers on Belarusian soil, just five kilometers from the Polish border and 50 kilometers from the Ukrainian border. As the war in Ukraine rages on, this decision is seen as a challenge to the West.

title: Political scientist Loïc Blondiaux: 'In France, compromise is often considered a weakness'
summary: The new Assemblée Nationale is no more ungovernable than most European parliaments. It offers a historic opportunity to break with the centralization of power and a political culture resistant to negotiation, says the academic.

title: Restricting abortion rights is leading to a rise in infant mortality in the US
summary: Two studies published in June have analyzed the consequences of the law restricting abortion rights in Texas. They showed an increase in infant mortality and a decline in contraception.

title: Is Paris hiding its tourist office, two weeks before the Games?
summary: The capital's tourist office has moved from the central rue de Rivoli to the 15th arrondissement. Hard to find online and difficult to identify, it struggles to attract visitors.

title: The Earth's population is expected to peak before the end of the century
summary: The number of human beings is set to peak at 10.3 billion in 2080, according to a United Nations report published on Thursday. And then begin to decline before the end of the century.

title: US election: Kamala Harris becomes tempting alternative to a weakened Joe Biden
summary: Long neglected and criticized, the vice president is now the preferred option for many Democrats calling on Joe Biden to withdraw from the presidential race.

title: Shelley Duvall, 'The Shining' actor, dies aged 75
summary: The intrepid movie star whose winsome presence was a mainstay in the films of Robert Altman and who co-starred in Stanley Kubrick's 'The Shining,' has died, aged 75.

title: Algerian President Abdelmadjid Tebboune says he's running for reelection
summary: A second term for Tebboune would further distance Algeria from the aspirations of its youth-fuelled pro-democracy movement in 2019, which ousted predecessor Abdelaziz Bouteflika after two decades in office.

title: Alleged victim and accused French rugby players give radically different accounts of 'rape with violence' case
summary: Hugo Auradou and Oscar Jégou are due to be transferred from Buenos Aires to Mendoza on July 11, where they will be brought before court.

title: Marine Tondelier's green blazer, a political object
summary: Like the woman who wears it, the prairie-green jacket of the leader of the French Greens has become a media star since the parliamentary elections.

title: French elections: Can the left repeal the pension reform if it comes to power?
summary: Jean-Luc Mélenchon has stated that the increase of the retirement age at 64 will be repealed by decree 'as early as this summer' if the left-wing alliance governs the country. The scenario is considered illegal by some, and possible by others.

title: Macron keeps a low profile at NATO summit
summary: The French president, who previously aimed to lead support for Ukraine, arrived discreetly and doesn't plan on giving a press conference.

title: Flemish nationalist Bart De Wever called to form a government in Belgium
summary: The likely future prime minister is a supporter of a confederal system, with broad autonomy granted to the regions.

title: Bone of Neanderthal child provides evidence of social care in prehistoric times
summary: The child, who probably had Down syndrome and suffered from pronounced hearing and balance problems, benefited from the support of his hunter-gatherer group. The discovery sheds light on the origin of compassion.

title: Rouen cathedral spire fire extinguished
summary: The mayor of the city in Normandy said that the cause of the blaze, which broke out at midday, was unknown at this stage. The spire, one of the tallest in Europe, was in the process of being refurbished.
